alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Plains; Northwest Plateau; Sandia and Manzano Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued May 09 at 4:01PM MDT until May 11 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 10 PM MDT WEDNESDAY FOR ALL AREAS BELOW SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE, AND LAL 6 ACROSS THE EAST... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING FOR THE NORTHWEST PLATEAU, RIO GRANDE AND LOWER CHAMA RIVER VALLEYS, SANDIA AND MANZANO MOUNTAINS, AND EASTERN PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .Strong winds will persist over the Northeast Highlands until early evening. Tonight, mostly poor humidity recovery is forecast there, and over central and western parts of the forecast area. Critical to extreme fire weather conditions are likely Wednesday over all zones. A very unstable airmass is expected Wednesday with isolated dry thunderstorms over the Four Corners region, and scattered to isolated dry thunderstorms from the Sangre de Cristo Mountains southeastward to around Portales and Clovis. After a Pacific cold front Wednesday night, strong northwest winds and very low humidities will return to most locations Thursday causing fire weather concerns to linger. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 10 PM MDT WEDNESDAY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau (Zone 101, Northeast Plains (Zone 104), Middle Rio Grande Valley (Zone 106), Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley (Zone 121), Sandia and Manzano Mountains (Zone 124), Central Highlands (Zone 125) East Central Plains (Zone 126) from 11 AM to 10 PM MDT Wednesday and from Thursday afternoon through Thursday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...South to southwest 25 to 40 mph with gusts to 50 or 55 mph on Wednesday with west winds at 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 40 to 50 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...7 to 15 percent each afternoon. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Plains; Northwest Plateau; Sandia and Manzano Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley
